page.title: 09Religion and churches
page.content:
Religious buildings in Church St and Well St.
The {vicarage }has been there since 1445, next door to the Manor House. It was built on the site of an old walnut yard. The{URC Chapel}was built in{1700 }to serve as a congregational church. It was{sold}to the university in 1983 and is now a lecture and concert hall. It is called the Radcliffe Centre. The {Oddfellows}Hall is occasionally used by this society. The Jehovah's Witnesses meet in the hall on Sundays, Tuesdays and Thursdays. The{methodist church} was built in 1791 and rebuilt on the same site in 1968. On Easter Day April 7th 1985 the {UCR}Chapel{and}the{methodist joined}to form one congregation.
